security_audit.summary: This skill contains only Markdown documentation files with TypeScript code examples. No executable code, network calls, credential access, or malicious patterns detected. All content is educational reference material for Payload CMS development.

content.user_title: Build Payload CMS applications with expert guidance
content.value_statement: Payload CMS development requires understanding complex patterns for collections, hooks, and access control. This skill provides comprehensive reference documentation to help you build secure, scalable CMS applications.
actual_capabilities: Configure collections with authentication, uploads, and versioning
Implement role-based access control with row-level security
Create hooks for data validation and side effects
Build custom REST API endpoints with proper authentication
Develop Payload plugins with TypeScript patterns
Query data using Local API, REST, and GraphQL
limitations: Does not execute code or run Payload servers
Cannot access external databases or APIs
Provides reference patterns, not project-specific solutions
Requires Payload CMS version 3.x for compatibility

output_examples.input: How do I restrict access to posts by organization?
output: Create an access control function that returns a query constraint
Check user.organization and return filter for matching documents
Admins bypass the filter with early return of true
Apply to read, update, and delete operations on the collection

best_practices: Always pass req to nested operations in hooks to maintain transaction atomicity
Set overrideAccess to false when performing Local API operations on behalf of users
Use context flags in hooks to prevent infinite loops when updating documents
anti_patterns: Passing user to Local API without setting overrideAccess to false bypasses all permissions
Performing nested database operations in hooks without passing req breaks transaction safety
Calling update on the same document in afterChange without context check causes infinite loops

faq.question: Which Payload versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill targets Payload CMS version 3.x which runs natively in Next.js. Earlier versions have different APIs.

faq.question: What are the limits on query depth?
faq.answer: Default relationship depth is 2. Set maxDepth on fields to control how deep relationships populate. Use depth 0 for IDs only.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing Next.js projects?
faq.answer: Payload 3.x installs directly in your Next.js app folder. Configure payload.config.ts and add admin routes to your app.

faq.question: Is my project data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only provides documentation. It cannot access your database, files, or network. All code runs in your environment.

faq.question: What if my hooks cause errors?
faq.answer: Check transaction threading by ensuring req is passed to all operations. Use context flags to prevent loops. Check hook execution order.

faq.question: How does this compare to other CMS skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses specifically on Payload CMS patterns. It covers TypeScript-first development with Next.js native integration.
